intro: Pachycarpus lebomboensis, commonly known as the Lebombo pachycarpus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
